description:
Affected Version:
    trunk, at git SHA ea94b09ad712adcf932a4f217e4061522ad875d1


Expected:
    `nova keypair-delete foo.bar` should delete the named key, provided it exists.


Actual:
    ERROR: Keypair foo not found for user $USER_ID (HTTP 404)



Repro:
    # install latest nova client
    sudo pip install -U git+https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient.git

    nova keypair-add foo.bar          # nova will add a key with a dot in the name just fine
    nova keypair-list                          # the name with dot is saved correctly
    nova keypair-delete foo.bar     # results in the error above
title: nova client will not delete a keypair whose name contains a dot.

comments.content:
Affected Version:
    trunk, at git SHA ea94b09ad712adcf932a4f217e4061522ad875d1


Expected:
    `nova keypair-delete foo.bar` should delete the named key, provided it exists.


Actual:
    ERROR: Keypair foo not found for user $USER_ID (HTTP 404)



Repro:
    # install latest nova client
    sudo pip install -U git+https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient.git

    nova keypair-add foo.bar          # nova will add a key with a dot in the name just fine
    nova keypair-list                          # the name with dot is saved correctly
    nova keypair-delete foo.bar     # results in the error above
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~tim-miller-0
https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~tim-miller-0

comments.content:
Tim,

latest devstack, i am not able to create "foo.bar" keypair-add fails with a 400

-- dims
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content: Which version of Nova are you using? Grizzly has a check to validate https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/api.py#L2715 (only valid chars are "_- " + string.digits + string.ascii_letters)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content:
Davanum,

  It turns out that this was observed on a Diablo-era openstack service.

  This bug should be closed, as this behavior is not possible in trunk, as you've pointed out.

  I apologize for any inconvenience.

  -Tim
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~tim-miller-0

comments.content:
Tim,

Thanks for the feedback, no apology necessary for trying to help.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alaski
